snippet: The Federal Communications Commission is considering giving online distributors like Hulu and YouTube the same rights and responsibilities enjoyed by cable companies.
abstract: Federal Communications Commission is considering whether to apply regulations designed for cable television providers to online distributors like Hulu and YouTube; shift would allow online companies to distribute a greater number of popular TV shows to computers and smartphones.

headline.main: If Video Sites Could Act Like Cable Companies
headline.print_headline: If Video Sites Could Act Like Cable Companies

snippet: Analysts wonder whether the news that Google now owns one of its hardware partners, Motorola, will drive some of its other hardware partners straight into the arms of competitors like Microsoft.
abstract: Analysts wonder whether the news that Google now owns one of its hardware partners, Motorola, will drive some of its other hardware partners straight into the arms of competitors like Microsoft.

headline.main: Will Microsoft Benefit From the Google-Motorola Deal?

snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes researchers who say today's teenagers' have concerns like those of earlier generations, despite new technology,...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday's selection includes researchers who say today's teenagers' have concerns like those of earlier generations, despite new technology, cities recruiting Apple Stores to move in and free Wi-Fi (sort of) from a group of cable companies.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Kickstarter Report and a Singing App

snippet: Though New York’s starred chefs could dine anywhere, many choose straightforward fare when they kick back.
abstract: New York's starred chefs could dine anywhere, and certainly proprietors of New York’s most distinguished restaurants would personally cook anything for them, but many culinary luminaries choose straightforward fare when they relax; favoring the casual and even the simple, they frequently return to the same couple of places and order the same thing, again and again.

headline.main: Follow a Hungry Chef and See Where It Takes You
headline.print_headline: Follow a Hungry Chef and See Where It Takes You

snippet: He didn’t deserve a long prison sentence. But many people deserve a bigger, better apology from him.
abstract: He didn’t deserve a long prison sentence. But many people deserve a bigger, better apology from him.

snippet: After months of waiting for approval from various regulatory bodies, Google said it had officially closed its $12.5 billion deal to acquire Motorola Mobility.
abstract: After months of waiting for approval from various regulatory bodies, Google said it had officially closed its $12.5 billion deal to acquire Motorola Mobility.

headline.main: Google Closes $12.5 Billion Deal to Buy Motorola Mobility

snippet: A judge said that RIM and Apple had not violated Kodak’s patent for digital image-preview technology, because the patent was invalid.
abstract: International Trade Commission Judge Thomas Pender says that Research in Motion and Apple did not violate Kodak’s patent for digital image-preview technology, because the patent was invalid; decision may hurt the value of assets Kodak is selling in bankruptcy.

headline.main: Kodak Loses Patent Case Against Apple and RIM
headline.print_headline: Kodak Loses a Ruling in a Patent Case Against Apple and RIM

snippet: Recovering alcoholics can now access various apps on mobile devices to track progress and connect with others in their situation.
abstract: Mobile application developed by the Hazelden Foundation gives alcoholics interactive access to the 12 steps, along with several other tools for battling their addiction.

headline.main: Sobriety Tools That Fit in a Pocket
headline.print_headline: Sobriety Tools That Fit in a Pocket

snippet: The Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index, where Apple accounts for 4 percent, had its best day in nearly five weeks.
abstract: Stocks rise, helped by Apple's 5.8 percent share climb.

headline.main: Propelled by Apple, Markets Post Gains After a Losing Week
headline.print_headline: Propelled by Apple, Markets Post Gains After a Losing Week

snippet: Apps like BuddyTV Guide, Peel and TV Guide let viewers find shows they want to watch more efficiently than by channel surfing.
abstract: Bob Tedeschi App Smart column notes apps like BuddyTV Guide, Peel and TV Guide let viewers find shows they want to watch more efficiently than by channel surfing. Photos (M)

headline.main: Seeing What's on TV Without Touching the Remote
